Description: Part of a sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; part of a Late Ramesside Letter from a high official (Payankh?) to some one in west Thebes (Dhutmose?) with a list of commissions. Now joined with 10302, with fragments from 75022.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Part of 10302. William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes.
Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 14-19, 46-49.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139355) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139355)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink (smudged) Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: filmoplast t self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
